metadata.description: Prohibited Foreign Entities under FEOC rules (IRA Section 30D/45X). Entities whose products disqualify projects from claiming 48E commercial ITC.
metadata.feoc_definition: A Foreign Entity of Concern (FEOC) is an entity owned by, controlled by, or subject to the jurisdiction of a government of a covered nation (China, Russia, North Korea, Iran). The 25% ownership/control threshold applies to any entity in the manufacturing supply chain.

thresholds.2024: FEOC-manufactured battery components disqualify from 30D clean vehicle credit
thresholds.2026_products: 40% of manufactured products must not be from PFE (Prohibited Foreign Entity) — increases 5% annually to 60% by 2029
thresholds.2026_batteries: 55% of manufactured battery products must not be from PFE — increases to 75% by 2029

entities.name: Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Limited (CATL)
entities.reason: Chinese-headquartered company. Subject to jurisdiction of PRC government. Largest battery manufacturer globally.
entities.us_presence: Proposed Ford joint venture plant in Marshall, MI (on hold). CATL licensing LFP technology to Ford. No confirmed operational US manufacturing as of Feb 2026.

entities.name: BYD Company Limited
entities.reason: Chinese-headquartered company. Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway owns ~7% but company is Chinese-controlled.
entities.us_presence: BYD battery storage units sold in US market. Some residential battery products available. No US manufacturing.

entities.name: LONGi Green Energy Technology Co., Ltd.
entities.reason: Chinese-headquartered and controlled. World's largest solar panel manufacturer by capacity. DOC found Vina Solar (LONGi subsidiary) circumventing US tariffs.
notable_customers_affected: US utility-scale developers (prior to tariff findings)
entities.us_presence: No US manufacturing. Vietnamese subsidiary Vina Solar found circumventing tariffs in 2024. Effectively blocked from US market.

entities.name: JA Solar Technology Co., Ltd.
entities.reason: Chinese-headquartered and controlled. Major global solar cell and module manufacturer.
entities.us_presence: No confirmed US manufacturing. SE Asian production subject to AD/CVD tariffs.

entities.name: Trina Solar Co., Ltd.
entities.reason: Chinese-headquartered and controlled. One of world's largest module shippers. Thailand production faces 375%+ AD/CVD tariff.
entities.us_presence: No US manufacturing. All production routes to US are heavily tariffed (Thailand 375%+, Vietnam 800%+, China Section 301).

entities.name: JinkoSolar Holding Co., Ltd.
entities.reason: Chinese-headquartered and controlled. US operations raided by federal agents in 2023 for AD/CVD circumvention investigation.
notable_customers_affected: US residential and commercial installers using Jacksonville-assembled modules
entities.us_presence: Jacksonville, FL module assembly plant (400 MW capacity). However, cells sourced from Malaysia/SE Asia. Chinese parent company makes entire operation FEOC. Not suitable for 48E ITC projects.

entities.name: Risen Energy Co., Ltd.
entities.reason: Chinese-headquartered and controlled. Solar panel and cell manufacturer.
entities.us_presence: No US manufacturing. Limited US market presence due to tariffs.

entities.name: Canadian Solar Inc. / CSI Solar Co., Ltd.
entities.parent_company: Canadian Solar Inc. (Canadian holding, Chinese operations)
entities.headquarters: Guelph, Ontario, Canada (holding) / Suzhou, China (CSI Solar operations)
entities.reason: Despite Canadian holding company restructuring, manufacturing subsidiaries (CSI Solar) are Chinese-controlled entities. FEOC status problematic for 48E ITC. Ownership restructuring may help but untested under final Treasury rules.
entities.us_presence: Mesquite, TX facility is distribution/warehouse only — not manufacturing. No confirmed US module manufacturing.

entities.name: Tongwei Co., Ltd.
entities.reason: Chinese-headquartered. World's largest solar cell manufacturer. Major polysilicon producer. Supplies cells to many module assemblers.
notable_customers_affected: Downstream module manufacturers that source Tongwei cells
entities.us_presence: No US manufacturing. Cells from Tongwei used in modules assembled elsewhere may trigger FEOC concerns.

entities.name: GCL Technology Holdings Limited
entities.reason: Chinese-controlled. Major polysilicon and wafer manufacturer. Granular polysilicon (FBR) technology.

entities.name: Maxeon Solar Technologies (partial FEOC concern)
entities.reason: TCL (Chinese company) holds 36.5% ownership stake, which likely exceeds the 25% FEOC threshold. Despite Singapore incorporation and manufacturing in Mexico, the TCL ownership makes Maxeon potentially FEOC-controlled.
entities.us_presence: No US manufacturing. Mexico production subject to 25% tariff. CBP UFLPA detentions ongoing.

entities.name: APsystems (Altenergy Power System Inc.)
subsidiaries: APsystems USA (Seattle, WA — sales office only)
entities.us_presence: Seattle sales office only. All manufacturing in Jiaxing, China.
